name: GECKGO
description:
Basically Lizard QWOP!

Made in 48 hours for the GMTK Game Jam 2021 (with the theme “JOINED TOGETHER”), GECKGO is a game about a lizard climbing out of a well.

The lizard’s limbs are joined together (via his body) and move together when unstuck from the wall.

It’s our first time playing around with procedural animation and inverse kinematics and it probably shows... but it’s hopefully good for a short laugh!

Thanks for playing!

 

CONTROLS

Each leg is mapped to a key and is stuck to the well by default. Pressing a key will unstick the leg and free it up for movement.

I - left arm             O - right arm

K - left leg               L - right leg

WASD - move all unstuck limbs and shift body weight in that direction 

(Note that J and ; can also be used to unstick the left and right legs respectively)

You can also use a controller... but it doesn't seem to work properly with the WebGL build so you might want to download one of the other builds to use it.

L1 - left arm             R1 - right arm

L2 - left leg               R2 - right leg

Left stick - move all unstuck limbs and shift body weight in that direction

Right stick - just move all unstuck limbs

THE TEAM

Jeremy Sapsed – Development

Robert Ashby – Misc

Rebecca Smith – Sound Effects

 

ADDITIONAL RESOURCES USED

Sound Effects - all sourced from the Platform Post (https://www.platformpp.tv/) sound database - with some changes made!

Font - Berlin Sans FB Demi

Jeremy had a rough lizard model from before the start of the jam, but it was heavily modified during the jam.
